results.title: Water on the land
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Planet Earth”.
Part 4 of a 4 part series, each program is divided into sections for easy classroom viewing and uses a combination of the latest computer graphics and filmed examples of climatic occurrences to provide a detailed description and explanation of the geographical factors influencing Planet Earth. This program looks at the water cycle; glaciated landscapes; river erosion - V-shaped valleys and waterfalls; meanders; oxbow lakes; and flood plains. Includes a teacher’s guide.

results.title: Stories on a train = The Tale of Georgie Grub ...
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
A video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by professional storytellers and have been selected for children aged five to eight years old. Introduced by Dorothy Butler. The stories are: “Troublesome pig”, ” The Grand old Duke of York”, “Grandma goes shopping”, “Lucky Hans”, “On Friday something funny happened”, “Wolf! Wolf!”, “The Tale of Georgie Grub”, “Everybody said no!”, “Mr. Biff the boxer” and “The Trouble with Jack”.

results.title: Weather & climate - precipitation
results.creator_credit: Ian Rosenbloom, European Broadcasting Union and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Planet Earth”.
Program 3 of a 4 part series. Each program is divided into sections for easy classroom viewing using a combination of the latest computer graphics, and filmed examples of climatic occurrences to provide a detailed description and explanation of the geographical factors influencing Planet Earth. This video aims to provide a detailed description and explanation of water in various forms: types of rainfall; prevailing winds; anticyclones; tropical storms and predicting the weather. Includes a teacher’s guide.

results.title: Stories at school = Alastair's elephant and nine other stories at school
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
A video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by professional storytellers and have been selected for children aged five to eight years old. The stories are: Mr. Tick the teacher, Look what I’ve got, Gumdrop: the adventures of a vintage car, Tinker, tailor, soldier, sailor, Sick cow, The House that grew, Alistair’s elephant, Kimi and the watermelon, How St. Francis tamed the wolf, The Bossing of Josie. Introduced by Dorothy Butler.

results.title: Tchaikovsky: Public triumph... personal despair
results.creator_credit: Graham Holloway, Bob Carruthers, Beckmann and Cromwell Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music maestro”.
Adoring audiences, international acclaim and an independent fortune should have made Tchaikovsky a happy man. Unfortunatley they seemed only to add to the secret anguish of a tortured soul hiding dark secrets from the stifling high society of 19th Century Russia. Innovative and informative, this program explores the character of the man and builds a picture of his life and times. Using feature films inserts, stunning period images and a masterful narrative by conductor/composer David Palmer, combined with superb performances by internationally renowned artists, this is an unforgettable record of the life of one of the world’s great composers. Featuring performances of such classics as: 1812 Overture, excerpts from Swan Lake, The Nutcracker Suite, the Slavonic March and more.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Graham Holloway, Bob Carruthers, Beckmann and Cromwell Productions

results.title: Tectonics
results.creator_credit: Ian Rosenbloom, European Broadcasting Union and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Planet Earth”.
Program 1 of a 4 part series. Each program is divided into sections for easy classroom viewing using a combination of the latest computer graphics and filmed examples of climatic occurrences to provide a detailed description and explanation of the geographical factors influencing Planet Earth. This video aims to provide a detailed description and explanation of the structure of the earth; plate tectonics; earthquakes at destructive and conservative margins; collision zones; fold mountains; and volcanoes. Includes a teacher’s guide.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Rosenbloom, European Broadcasting Union and Yorkshire Television

results.title: Teatime stories = The House that Jack built and nine other teatime stories
results.creator_credit: Gerben Cath and International Video Books
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
A video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by professional storytellers and have been selected for children aged one to five years old. Stories include Super Adam and Rosie Wonder, Ahhh! said Jack, Apple tree, The House that Jack built, The Smallest turtle, Seaside Christmas tree, Donkey’s tale, Peter Piper’s birthday party, Peepbo!, Wilberforce goes shopping. Introduced by Dorothy Butler.
